sentences.en: As a member of the nobility, his life had been one of wealth and privilege.
sentences.cn: 身为贵族中的一员, 他过着有钱有势的生活.

sentences.en: But Hooper, my newest - joined platoon leader , grudged them their life of privilege.
sentences.cn: 但是, 我们最近来的排长胡珀, 嫉妒那些人舒服生活.

sentences.en: Having been born to privilege in old Hollywood, she was carrying on a family tradition by acting.
sentences.cn: 她出身于过去好莱坞的名门，继承了当演员的家族传统。

sentences.en: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.cn: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

sentences.en: I consider it a privilege, therefore, to be charged under it.
sentences.cn: 因此我认为我能担同样的罪名是一种荣幸.

sentences.en: I once had the privilege of meeting the late philosopher CLR James.
sentences.cn: 我曾经有幸和已故的哲学家C。L。R。詹姆士会面。

sentences.en: It is a great privilege to know you.
sentences.cn: 认识你是一件难得的事.

sentences.en: It must be a privilege to know such a man.
sentences.cn: 认识这样的人肯定很荣幸。

sentences.en: It was a privilege to hear her sing / hearing her sing.
It's a privilege to serve such distinguished rummies as you.
sentences.cn: 能侍候上象您这样的酒鬼,真是三生有幸.

sentences.en: Pironi was the son of privilege and wealth, and it showed.
sentences.cn: 皮罗尼出身于有钱有势的豪门，这看得出来。

sentences.en: Recently I had the privilege of inaugurating 45 new upgraded Thanas.
sentences.cn: 最近,我有幸参加了四十五个较高一级的“塔纳”的成立典礼.

sentences.en: This sense of privilege tends to be reinforced by the outside world.
sentences.cn: 这种优越感往往会被外部世界强化。

sentences.en: To be loused up by Humboldt was really a kind of privilege.
sentences.cn: 说老实话,被洪堡糟踏一下倒是一种荣幸.

sentences.en: Why people are prepared to tolerate a four hour journey each day for the dubious privilege of living in the country is beyond my ken.
sentences.cn: 为了农村生活的模糊的好处,人们为何甘愿忍受每天在路上花四个小时,这便超越了我的见识了.

words.tran_cn: 享有特权的；有特别恩典的
给予…特权；免除（privilege的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 特权；特别优惠；特殊许可

trans.tran_en: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people
to treat some people or things better than others

trans.tran_cn: 给予特权， 特别优待
trans.tran_en: to treat some people or things better than others
